class.name: CSGSculptedTexture3D
class.brief_description: A texture-based sculpted primitive for highly variable organic shapes.
class.description: CSGSculptedTexture3D is a texture-based sculpted primitive that extends CSGSculptedPrimitive3D. Unlike parametric primitives, this uses a texture where RGB values encode 3D coordinates: - Red channel (R) = X coordinate - Green channel (G) = Y coordinate - Blue channel (B) = Z coordinate Each pixel's RGB values (0-255) are mapped to coordinates (-1 to 1), allowing for highly variable organic shapes defined by texture data. This node allows you to create complex sculpted shapes for use with the CSG system. The texture should typically be 64x64 or 128x128 pixels for best results. [b]Note:[/b] CSG nodes are intended to be used for level prototyping. Creating CSG nodes has a significant CPU cost compared to creating a [MeshInstance3D] with a [PrimitiveMesh].

members.member: If [code]true[/code], inverts the Z coordinate, flipping the shape along the Z axis.

The texture used for sculpting. RGB values encode XYZ coordinates: - Red (R) = X coordinate - Green (G) = Y coordinate - Blue (B) = Z coordinate Each channel value (0-255) maps to coordinates (-1 to 1). Typically 64x64 or 128x128 pixels for best results.
